page.title: 11LANDSCAPE AND BUILDING
page.content: IN THE{LUTHRIE}AND{MOONZIE}AREAS THERE ARE{HOUSES}RANGING FROM{JACOBEAN THROUGH{GEORGIAN}AND{VICTORIAN }TO { {MODERN}STYLES.THE{OLDEST HOUSES}IN {LUTHRIE}ARE THE{FARM COTTAGES}AND THE {FARM HOUSES}WHICH ARE ABOUT{300 YEARS OLD AND STILL IN USE. THERE IS THE{REMAINS}OF A{CASTLE}AT {LORDSCAIRNIE}WHICH WAS OWNED BY A MAN CALLED{"TIGER" CRAWFORD}IN THE{ 15th CENTURY.{MOONZIE CHURCH}WAS USED AS A LAND MARK TO HELP SAILORS NAVIGATE, BUT IT IS NOT USED AS A CHURCH ANYMORE.THERE ARE THE{REMAINS OF A{CASTLE}AND A{DOOCOT}AT{PARBROATH. AT{LUTHRIE}A{JACOBEAN}HOUSE WAS ONCE USED AS A{SMITHY.
